comments.value:
This is to replace any previous open weekend ticket.

The current /known/ to do list is:
On the events listings page:
- put in a free text search field
- update the font to white in the blue boxes where the listings are (this is a bug already mentioned - needs to be addressed ASAP)
- update the 'event type' list dropdown to include all the open weekend categories (architecture, photography, etc)
- create an 'Open Weekend' option in the event date field (and specify that it is 23-25 July)
- update the promo image

On the individual event pages
- display the 'challenge' field for open weekend events
- ensure that related photos is on/working on events pages

Could you please quote on how much time this will take?  Thanks!

Hi Liz,

Couple of quick questions/clarifications..

1)  Just to check we're talking about this page ?

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php

2) Put in a free text search field

At top or bottom of exiting pull down menus? I'd say bottom?

3) Blue text

Oh didn't realise that was still an issue, will fix ASAP..

4) "create an 'Open Weekend' option in the event date field (and specify that it is 23-25 July)"

By this do you just mean you want a check-box (under the other options) that overrides any date range entered in the Event date pulldown.

* I guess ideally it would default the 'Event date' to 'Any date' or 'Open weekend - 23-25 July" in Javascript, althoguh this may require a couple of hours more work to code / test. Do we need Javascript and if so what is the default option?

5) Update the promo image

What one? Do we have an image / link?

thanks

Finger in the air I'd say a day, but might creep into two days especially if we have to start coding JS to deal with dates and/or remembering options etc. / factoring in time for testing / tweaks.

Jamie

1) yes

2) Bottom is fine

3) Thanks

4) I actually meant put 'Open Weekend' as an option in the
dropdown (in addition to 'all events in the next week' etc). I think we
might at some point want it to default to 'Open weekend' or at least we
would want to be able to 'preselect' it, so that when we send people
through to the event search page from the open weekend section, the page
would have already run the search for open weekend events. Does that
make sense?

5) We don't have the image yet, but I will come up with one :-)

 

2 days should be fine - let's clarify the issues around 4 and then we
can confirm!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Janos,

Still waiting sign-off form Liz (imminent)

Do you want to take control of this (you may need lots of CMS help and do feel free to pick mine or Kieran's brains, esp. as some of this stuff like the search is done elsewhere so you may as well follow that pattern, also in terms of where stuff lives etc.)

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php

1) put in a free text search field

This is just a new free text field (look at how we do photo search)

2) update the font to white in the blue boxes where the listings are (this is a bug already mentioned - needs to be addressed ASAP)

done

3) update the 'event type' list dropdown to include all the open weekend categories (architecture, photography, etc)

I think we currently use a taxonomy to generate this list, but ideally we'd just pull back the ones we have in the CMS (using a Finder)

4) create an 'Open Weekend' option in the event date field (and specify that it is 23-25 July)

See Liz's reply..

--
I actually meant put 'Open Weekend' as an option in the
drop down (in addition to 'all events in the next week' etc). I think we
might at some point want it to default to 'Open weekend' or at least we
would want to be able to 'preselect' it, so that when we send people
through to the event search page from the open weekend section, the page
would have already run the search for open weekend events. Does that
make sense? 
--

So actually this is two bits of work:

   a) add a flag to the search page so that the drop down can be pre-selected ie. searchtype=openweekend
   b) also if you come to the page with searchtype=openweekend the default upcoming events should all be 'openweekend' ones
   c) make that option fix the date to 23-25 July in the backend

5) update the promo image 

Liz to supply an image (TBH I still need her to clarify what promo it is that she want's updating, maybe she means the one at the top of the page)
I just spoke to Liz about this one. She does want us to go ahead, but she wants an estimate, because some of this work may be billable separately.
Liz, for  the purposes of internal billing, we estimate that each item on this list will take no more than half a day, so I suggest billing 0.5 days per item. We are starting work now.

Only point - 3 is a bug. Can you please bill accordingly? 

 

Also, sorry to be pedantic, but I wouldn't have thought changing the
lead image was half a day's work. I know it will take some of your
time, but I can't really agree to a blanket .5 days per item.

 

We would want to charge for the 'showing challenge', 'adding open
weekend dates' and 'adding open weekend categories' together. Is it
safe to say that all three of those is about a day's work?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Hi Liz,

Bit of confusion here I think (...so let me add to it!).

I think Danny is saying our minimum '*estimate*' is 0.5 days, obviously replacing an image is going to come in at less than that, we have never charged 0.5 day for changing something as simple as an image nor would we ever I expect to (it's more a ceiling in case the work 'slightly' changes in scope before we start, we hit issues or spend a huge about of time discussing it which sometime happens)

I didn't even count 3 [the bug] in this estimate, likewise I'm sure the image is fairly insignificant (actually where does it go?) part of the work.

The work is actually on i) adding the free text search and ii) the open weekend option, the 'date/period pulldown' are all periods 'from today' the open weekend option is to find events 'between two dates') and the iii) categories swith over. It's not just the work but the testing it cross browser, deployment, tweaks etc. not to mention time spent discussing this. 

As I said it may will creep into two days, 1.5 is probably where this will end up, but if your re-billing and need a upfront fixed cost/estimate then 2 days.

The image we'll just change as part of this ticket once you send it over.

Jamie

Ok, let's do a formal estimate of 2 days. Is there any way you could
indicate (in a similarly formal way) what bits of it are open weekend
related (challenge, etc, as mentioned below). Is that a day? I'm
struggling a bit with reasonable accounting, here...

 

 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

I actually realised we need to make a slight ammendment.

In addtion to having an 'Open weekend' item in the date drop down, we need a way for people to search for events on either/all of Friday, Saturday, and Sunday for that weekend.  I think last year we had three tickboxes.  So would it be possible for the three tick boxes to appear if the 'open weekend' item is selected?
I've started looking to it yesterday afternoon. Additionally, there are some database fringes we need to clean up, should be unnoticeable.

Can you please have a look at this:
http://london2012dev.kitsite.com/get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php?age=openweekend

Changes:
- Event date now has an open weekend option
- "Interested in" is expanded by the open weekend categories
- New free text search

Nb not all events are there on dev.

hmm... this doesn't look any different than the live site?

 _____
Ah sorry, wasn't published, now it is.

Cool!

- you can only see the '23' in the 'all open weekend events' in the drop down
- we need to figure out some way of letting ppl pick only the 23rd, 24th, or 25th, if they select open weekend (maybe tick boxes)
- it's called 'Inspire programme' not 'Inspired programme'
- we'll also need a 'Discovering Places' tick box next to the 'Inspire programme' one. (I think this was in the original brief, which I realise isn't part of this ticket, but thought it was worth unifying)

- when i ran the search, it came up with 'Club Coach and Volunteer Support which is happening in April. Which isn't an Open Weekend date. Is that just b/c in the back-end it's got the open weekend tick box? I know the dev events aren't all updated

Also, the details on the event details page are all misaligned, which I thought we fixed. Not sure if I'm supposed to be checking that, though!

Liz

 _____

1) There's a tiny tiny place in the dropdown - I've changed the copy, maybe. (Dropdowns render v differently in each browser, can you tell which was it?)
2) I'll ask jamie what can we do
3) I'm afraid we have inspired on live. Either way, I've changed it.
4) i'll ask J about this as well
5) Yes, I cheekily marked a random event as open weekend - 
6) do you have an url for an event that doesn't look right? I'll have a look at this as well.
REassigning to Jamie re 2./4.

http://london2012dev.kitsite.com/events/club-coach-and-volunteer-support.php

 _____

Hi Liz,

Sorry for me jumping in here, but (given the clean up I have just been looking ta on Events) I'm trying to stop us getting back into a situation where we make changes for the immediate need without thinking about the wider consequences.

1) we need to figure out some way of letting ppl pick only the 23rd, 24th, or 25th, if they select open weekend (maybe tick boxes)

We don't actually have that information on the event or the submission form in any structured format.
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/open-weekend/information-for-event-organisers/submit-an-event/index.php

We could in theory add two new check boxes for Open weekend Sat [x] | Sun [ ] (although someone would need to go back and fill them in by hand) but these would be flags and not dates (in terms of search by dates).

This means we could use them to visually flag up particular events as Sat/Sun/Both and in addition we could add two new check boxes under the normal search options (Saturday only [ ] Sunday only [ ]) when Open weekend is selected that limited events to just that day, we'd also need to get these to remember the submitted values and auto check those boxes when the page is submitted.

None of the above is trivial and without issue:

a) all events will end up with these two new check boxes, given the amount of OW fields already on the Events page maybe two more isn't going to break the camels back
b) someone will need to fix up all the existing events
c) we'll need to update the OW submission form, the code that handles form submissions and the event page itself.
d) we'll need to add new check boxes (and sort out the css/layout) for them to the search form and make sure they only appear when OpenWeeknd option is selected); we'll also need to make these boxes auto check when a search is performed.
e) we'll need to change the search engine to take account of the two new boxes and then limit the results to Open Weekend events with with the Sat or Sun checkboxes.
f) this field won't actually affect any date searches (as it's not a date field it's just a flag; probably not an immediate issue, just means that events will stil have to be given a start/end date as they currently are)
f) develop on dev, test, deploy to live and test some more

All in all at least a days work.

2) we'll also need a 'Discovering Places' tick box next to the 'Inspire programme' one. 

Is this just on the Event itself (and the CMS event interface) or do you also need it on the OW event submission form as well?

Either way this one is simpler than the above, so shouldn't be a problem, can we open a separate ticket for it though.

(and then I'll stop hijacking Janos' ticket !) 

thanks

Jamie

1) Don't we have exactly that? All the events have start/end dates! In date format!

2) It's already on the OW event submission form. It's the tick box of 'expressing interest'. When an event goes live, if that box is ticked it will BE a disovering places event. We will manually un-tick it if we don't want it to come up as one.

 _____

1) You right !! I initially thought there was 3 days (including a bank 
holiday) which is what made it tricker, and then amended my email 
without realising that for 3 days it went away.

It does need some extra logic in the back end to deal with working out 
how to further limit dates, but yes much easier.

2) Ah, so that's what 'expressing interest' is, in that case it's just 
the checkbox and some extra processing logic in the search

OK in that case less probably a morning work

Jamie

Actually you do have three days?

- we need to figure out some way of letting ppl pick only the 23rd, 24th, or 25th, if they select open weekend (maybe tick boxes)

Liz I have opened a new tickets for these two issues so we can discuss them / agree them there and Janos can finish off close / this ticket.

1) Event search : Open Weekend checkboxes
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/869

2) Event search : add a 'Discovering Places' tick box next to the 'Inspire programme' one.
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/867

Jamie
Liz, regarding the misaligned event pages - it might have been a cache issue, I don't see misalignment atm. Can you confirm / drop a screenshot?

Am running now - looks ok in chrome and ff. Please check both Ie and 8 as that's where i noticed.
________________________________________

So we can go live with the keyword now, but we can't go live with the Open Weekend option in the date, and we can't go live with the full list of event types.  That possible?

- let's make sure we don't forget the two new tickets

And remind me that it will be easy for me to change the header picture on that page (once I send it through to you)?

Open weekend search gone live with two changes:

- 'inspired programme' changed to 'inspire programme' (however got confused by the logo saying 'inspired by london 2012')

and tested it with the keyword asdf - i'm not sure if we want asdf here:

comments.value: Suggest plan, HTML holding page and alternative host, construct PDF help guide
Suggested solution for emergency web site, need to discuss exact requirements / what kind of budget is available for this work, as both will effect the scope of it.
Updated due date from LOCOG: 5/3.
An emergency html page is being created - will forward when available.

Hi Morag,

Does this need to go in the CMS and be editable? 

I assume the ideal would be sync up with content from the main home page automatically?

Do we also need to host it on a different server/ISP to the main ones? is this in hand? (have suggestions on how to achieve this but wil wait for your reply)
Hi there, both good points. It depends on where we are going to put this page - let me check with Huw and I'll get back to you!
Well past our due date. Could you suggest a new date?

I actually already have this emergency page - we just need to upload it.

 

I was thinking it would live in the folder Temporary > Pages >
Unavailable.

 

Is it possible to upload this and ensure it doesn't appear in the site
search?

 

________________________________

OK This is now done, we may want to talk about how you can switch it over yourself later:

1) Temp index template and Content templates now in the CMS along with all the assets

'Unavailable - Home' and 'Unavailable - Content' respectively you can create pages with either.

2) I have crated two pages in /temporary/pages/unavailable/

The first is a "Sorry, london2012.com is temporarily unavailable" page made with 'Unavailable - Home' who's path *is* important (see below) but feel free to update the text.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/temporary/pages/unavailable/index.html

The second is a test page made with 'Unavailable - Home' is just an example page and nothing depends on it (but you can link the above page to pages created with this template)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/temporary/pages/unavailable/index.html

I'm not sure if you want both an emergency site and a  "Sorry, london2012.com is temporarily unavailable" page.

Maybe the 'emergency site' could live in the /temporary/pages/HTML folder ?

3) Everything in /temporary/ is hidden from the search engine

4) Switchover / how to use 

As I understand it there are several use cases;

i) As a maintenance page if we have to take all or some of the site down, in which case we want to redirect users here.
/temporary/pages/unavailable/

To this end I have setup some redirects (commented out) in the Apache .htaccess access file ready for use whenever we need them [I have included them below for technical reference; they are also sitting in the config file with a comment]. This is a technical task, but should be fairly easy for anyone with basic technical knowledge to do, please let me know if you woudl like some more detailed instructions on this; it may make sense to add them to any 'emergency plan' you have.

ii) An emergency site, in case of well, emergencies. I guess the two things you are covering here are 

a) the facility to have ready / put up a simple site in case of a major issue or news story and you just want all attention focused on that and not the site as a whole 

b) an issue with networks etc. and you just want a site you can edit by hand [it should be noted you can already edit 99% of the site by hand as it is all HTML/PHP on the live severs].

If you create a small site within /temporary/pages/html/ (or any other directory) we can write up some notes for you on how we would 

a) switch to it and
b) how you could edit it on the live servers directly if need be.

The third thing you may want is a copy of that emergency site synced to a server *outside* of the main server environment, this is something I haven't covered in this ticket but may be worth considering.  

So the things not covered in this ticket (which you may want to open a separate ticket for, but may want to discuss first) are:

- documentation on switching to maintenance mode for 3rd parties (above what is described above, this will have a technical element) 
- documentation on switching to an emergency site for 3rd parties (above what is described above, this will have a technical element) 
- editing of the emergency site direct on the live server and how to sync content to the rest of the farm (familiarity with HTML and FTP will be required as will access the the servers, you may need to decide who and how people get access to the live servers to make sure we don't breach any security implications)
- synchronization of emergency site to a 3rd party server (it may be that you want this server outside of BT's network to cover all eventualities)

thanks

Jamie

Switching to a temp page for maintenance, this is commented otu in .htaccess at the root of the site

Hi Liz,

Yes I changed it due to the strapline issues / the strapline being 
removed.

I didn't realise it was begin imported anywhere automatically and 
therefore that order was important.

What do we do about the strapline field, just output a blank? 
[remember the description field *is* the strapline]

Jamie

Hm. Depends on how the ordering is. Could you put the actual content of the description field into the column she’s called ‘strapline’ (you can call it description) and just get rid of strapline (the duplicate) all together?

Hi Liz,

That's what I did, but then the columns bunch up..

Sorry if it sounds like I am being awkward, I'm honestly not, but we 
removed the duplicated field (as we we're asked to, in a roundabout 
way) and now we are being asked to add it back, I just want everyone 
to understand what they are getting and any implications. As I 
understood it the export wasn't being imported into any system and 
therefore the order of field (other than where to look for them) was 
unimportant.

I'm just a bit concerned at the trouble the ad-hoc nature of changes 
have caused us so far.

I will add both fields back in, we're actually almost live now so 
expect the number of changes from no won will be low.

But we really do need to have more change control over these kind of 
changes in future, almost like a checklist before anything is done:

- Request
- Reason
- Possibly people this will affect (and time to think about it)
- Possibly systems this will affect (and time to think about it)
- Data integrity issues with this change
- What code needs changing, order of changes and date of change(decide 
on)

The ad-hoc changing of fields is something that might not seem (and 
may not be) particularly technically hard to do, but if they are made 
in isolation the repercussions can be very expensive to rectify later 
on.

I think we need may need to make a rule that any change to a data 
model, needs at least 24hrs thought and be agreed by Kieran or myself.

btw. can I just say there is absolutely no finger pointing here, if 
anything I should have enforced the above from day one as it is 
totally unrealistic to expect the Open Weekend team to understand why 
a simple change may not always be as simple as it seams or can't be 
changed immediately.

As I said above I will reinstate the duplicate field, and make both 
description and strapline field output what (in the back end) is 
called description (ie. a short summary line / paragraph)

thanks

Jamie

I’m not asking you to put it back? I really, literally, just want the columns in their original order. You never got rid of all the columns, anyway! They just reshuffled, and the strapline one came in blank.

Ok I think it back as it was, hadr to tell as I only had one old version of the file to go on.

Jamie

Hi Liz,

Are you simply talking about the overlaid images on the home page and 
are happy with the high visibility style sheet on the rest of the site?

If so then yes that is something we can look at fixing, if not read 
on...

Jamie

---

Unless I am mistaken / you are talking about a single issue that has 
recently broken, the high visibility style sheet has never looked 100% 
correct since the re-launch and even some time before that.

The reason why I am hesitant to handle a ticket labelled 'fix high-vis 
style sheet' without prior discussion is that you could effectively be 
asking us to (retrospectively) create a universal style sheet that 
covers all types of pages and content (legacy, new, forms, flash etc.)

That's not to say it can't or shouldn't be done, simply stating that 
it is a very open ended and possibly large piece of work and we need 
to be clear what the budget / our remit is here before we start.

I'm not even clear myself what the high-vis style sheet /should/ look 
like. Is it OK that all text just display without any layout, ie. 
elements just list one after?

It may be that you decide that it might make more sense to tackle the 
high vis by taking the 'dyslexic' style sheet (which does seem to work 
in most places) and just change the colour of it? Or (given a possibly 
high cost) of retrospectively creating the perfect high viz style 
sheet you may want to query with Ability.net if this is the best 
approach / use of budget and if times have moved on and people now 
adjust stuff like this in their own browsers.

First, let’s get the overlapping images sorted on the homepage.


Second, ‘I'm not even clear myself what the high-vis style sheet /should/ look
like. Is it OK that all text just display without any layout, ie.
elements just list one after?’ --> yes, this is pretty much it

If you assign a big image to a small image container they should just

size / resize the image for you anyway)

Reminder to us all: this needs attention (cf Jamie's email earlier today).

Yes, I'll be speaking to Jamie re: this.

________________________________

Please find attached the full set of five template designs for Young Leaders. 

I have just spoken to Grant at Collective and they are (inevitably....) running a bit behind. They are aiming to have the full set of templates with you on Thursday. 

Could we catch up on this, as I know there are going to be challenges to our timelines now.

Hi Morag,

Feel free to edit the following pages (in fact any page in that section is fine for you to edit / add images to now)

1) Pages
---------

Young leaders Home page (we have hidden the news; where does news come from?, Twitter and Facebook feeds for now - lets discuss)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/young-leaders/index.php

Young leaders About page:
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/young-leaders/about/index.php

Meet the young leaders holding page:
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/young-leaders/meet/meet-the-young-leaders.php

* this is the holding page until you have created and written a page for ever user, let us know if you want to rename this page as we have hard coded the filename in the global nav


2) User profiles
-----------------

You need to create one profile per user /before/ you can create a blog post for them *but* we can hide any links to these pages for now saving you have to complete a full profile just yet.
